definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)

sentences.english: I'll sew my bridal dress for next life with delight.
sentences.chinese: 我要在那儿欣喜地缝制，来世出嫁的霓裳。

sentences.english: If there are these three major pcs, that miss gets married of time have high social standing.
sentences.chinese: 如果有了这三大件，那姑娘出嫁的时候是很有面子的。

sentences.english: A married woman usually bears her husband's surname.
sentences.chinese: 女子出嫁以后通常随夫姓。

sentences.english: Get married eventually when remnant daughter when, of marring too early already was in basically make a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 当剩女终于出嫁的时候，早婚的基本已在闹离婚了。

sentences.english: The second married was Mabai girl.
sentences.chinese: 二回出嫁的是玛白姑娘。

sentences.english: Mabel had no associates of her own sex, after her sister went away.
sentences.chinese: 自从姐姐出嫁后，马贝尔就再没有闺中密友了。

sentences.english: They want the girls to stay home and do housework and get married.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望女儿留在家里，做家务，然后出嫁。

sentences.english: The smart Nuosi was the eighth married.
sentences.chinese: 聪明的诺姒第八个出嫁。

sentences.english: The third married was the girl Yuebai.
sentences.chinese: 第三出嫁的是约白姑娘。

sentences.english: Daughters from the majority Hindu population are traditionally given gold ornaments for their marriage.
sentences.chinese: 大多数印度人家女儿出嫁时，都要赠送黄金饰品。

sentences.english: I never thought that my kid sister would get married.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没想过，我的小妹会出嫁。

sentences.english: Two of her girls had been on the point of marriage, and after all there was nothing in it.
sentences.chinese: 两个女儿本来快要出嫁了，到头来只落得一场空。

sentences.english: The next day, May the twenty-fifth, was Mannia's wedding day.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，五月二十五日，是曼娘出嫁的日子。

sentences.english: Now she was wearing a long robe with sleeves, for thus were the virgin daughters of the king dressed.
sentences.chinese: 那时他玛穿著彩衣，因为没有出嫁的公主都是这样穿。

sentences.english: After they were married, their sisters would congratulate on the third day.
sentences.chinese: 然后女孩子出嫁以后，要贺三朝。

sentences.english: And then she told me you were getting married. ‘Mónica is to wed, ' she said.

definition: to reach marriageable age (a girl's fifteenth birthday)
to take a wife/to get married (man)
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to live as widow/to observe widowhood
